entities.name: malfoy
entities.description: Malfoy is introduced as the one who provoked Harry and George. He is described as having a jaw that was bruised by Harry's knuckles (Chapter 19, page 414).

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is introduced as the one who had his knuckles bruised against Malfoy's jaw. He is also described as entering Professor McGonagall's office with George (Chapter 19, page 414).

entities.name: george
entities.description: George is introduced as the one who entered Professor McGonagall's office with Harry (Chapter 19, page 414).

entities.name: professor mcgonagall
entities.description: Professor McGonagall is introduced as the one who came marching along the corridor behind Harry and George. She is described as wearing a Gryffindor scarf, but tore it from her throat with shaking hands (Chapter 19, page 414).

entities.name: snitch
entities.description: The Snitch is introduced as the object that was found by Harry. It has silver wings protruding from between his fingers (Chapter 19, page 414).

entities.name: gryffindor scarf
entities.description: The Gryffindor scarf is introduced as the one that Professor McGonagall was wearing. She tore it from her throat with shaking hands (Chapter 19, page 414).

relationships.description: Harry and George were provoked by Malfoy. This is described in the text as 'Malfoy provoked us' (Chapter 19, page 414).
Harry and George were defended by Professor McGonagall. This is described in the text as 'In!' she said furiously, pointing to the door (Chapter 19, page 414).
George was also defended by Professor McGonagall. This is described in the text as 'In!' she said furiously, pointing to the door (Chapter 19, page 414).
